p: The incubation period of COVID may average between two to seven days (range of one to two weeks). Clinical manifestation is characterized by systemic symptoms such as high fever, chills, cough, shortness of breath or difficulty in breathing, diarrhea, myalgia or fatigue, expectoration, and hemoptysis. In severe forms, the patients may develop pneumonia, and the case fatality rates may vary considerably. Serious complications such as heart failure, respiratory failure, and liver failure most likely occur in elderly patientsÂ [ 8, 10, 13].
